meanings.definition: The act of embodying in flesh or taking on a bodily form.
meanings.sent1: The incardinations of the characters in the story made them seem real and alive.
meanings.sent2: The artist's incardinations of emotions in the painting were truly captivating.
meanings.sent3: The incardinations of the playful puppy brought joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: In the world of dreams, the incardinations of thoughts take on surreal shapes.
meanings.sent5: The incardinations of nature's beauty in the sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming incarnate or manifest in physical form.
meanings.sent1: The incardinations of the spirit into the physical body are a mystery of life.
meanings.sent2: Through meditation, one may experience the incardinations of inner peace.
meanings.sent3: The incardinations of the cake into a delicious dessert were a success.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the incardinations of the characters on stage mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The incardinations of music in the concert hall filled the air with harmony.
